dmca.title: Curator of Early Office Museum accepts no copies
dmca.body:
Dear Sir/Madam:

1.	Copyrighted work that has been infringed

I am the creator and owner of the first of the following internet sites. I am also the creator, co-owner, and other co-owner's agent for the second of the following internet sites. These two sites are known as the Early Office Museum. I hold the copyright on the content of these sites, excluding certain images, for which copyright is held by others.

My Internet Site No.1: http://www.earlyofficemuseum.com My Internet Site No. 2: http://www.officemuseum.com

2.	Material that is infringing upon the copyrighted work listed in #1 above

My copyrighted work on the preceding internet sites is being infringed by the internet site identified at the end of this paragraph. The latter site has duplicated one or both of my web sites as they existed in 2004. Each "child" page under the page I identify below is also duplicated from my web sites and infringes my copyright. Insofar as I have been able to determine, the infringer has merely removed email links to the museum curator.

Infringing Internet Site: http://www.netangola.com/EarlyOffice/Museum Examples of search results that directly link to webpages with infringing material:

Google Search
Search Query No. 1: "early office museum" netangola
Infringing webpages: www.netangola.com/EarlyOfficeMuseum/ communications_equipment.htm, www.netangola.com/EarlyOfficeMuseum/

Search Query No. 2: "Between the 1880s and 1910s, numerous inventors and companies took up the challenge of supplying offices, schools, draftsmen, artists, and eventually homes with efficient machines to sharpen lead pencils."
Infringing web page: www.netangola.com/ EarlyOfficeMuseum/pencil_sharpeners.htm
Search Query No. 2 is simply an example. If one uses as a search query any of a large number of the sentences used on my website, one obtains a page on the infringing web site as one of the hits.
 
3.	My contact information is below.

[private]
[private]
Alexandria, VA 22302-2826 USA
email: [private]@earlyofficemuseum.com

Contact information for infringing webpages

I have not been able to contact anyone connected with the infringing webpages. When I try to go to the home page http://www.netangola.com, my browser takes me to http://www.nexus.ao/. My impression is that the latter website is hosted in Angola and is in Portuguese.

5.	I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing webpages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

6.	I swear, under penalty of perjury consistent with United States Code Title 17, Section 512, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

Sincerely,


[private]
[private]
Alexandria, VA 22302-2826 USA 
email: [private]@earlyofficemuseum.com
